issue.title: <frame/>: Support multiple frames in a single parent? Intended scope of frames? Use link names as frames?

content.raw:
Question 2.a: If you don't specify the `frame` attribute for the `<pose>` element, it currently takes as a default value the conventions from earlier version of sdformat, which is usually the frame of the parent element, except in the case of a `<joint><pose>`, which will take the name of the child link.

There are tests that confirm this behavior in pull request #468 using the [double_pendulum.sdf](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/21d2cbe52bbd104f24a50b0037e5b3da5657c644/test/sdf/double_pendulum.sdf?fileviewer=file-view-default) example:

* default joint pose frame test added to `test/integration/joint_dom.cc` in 3f04e7c35e1b
* default link pose frame, which is model name, is tested in [test/integration/link_dom.cc](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/3f04e7c35e1b11cd43c9719a8fba7077fa11b611/test/integration/link_dom.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#link_dom.cc-285:323)
* default collision pose frame, which is model name, is tested in [test/integration/collision_dom.cc](#!/osrf/sdformat/src/3f04e7c35e1b11cd43c9719a8fba7077fa11b611/test/integration/collision_dom.cc?at=pose_dom&fileviewer=file-view-default#collision_dom.cc-104:110)
content.html:
Question 2.a: If you don't specify the frame attribute for the <pose> element, it currently takes as a default value the conventions from earlier version of sdformat, which is usually the frame of the parent element, except in the case of a <joint><pose>, which will take the name of the child link.

There are tests that confirm this behavior in pull request #468 using the double_pendulum.sdf example:

  • default joint pose frame test added to test/integration/joint_dom.cc in 3f04e7c35e1b
  • default link pose frame, which is model name, is tested in test/integration/link_dom.cc
  • default collision pose frame, which is model name, is tested in test/integration/collision_dom.cc
